5.m: The sacrifices of God are a broken spirit; a broken and contrite heart, O God, you will not despise. - Psalm 51:17 (ESV)

l.q: Based on 1 Samuel 11, against whom did David sin?
l.a: David sinned not only against Uriah and Bathsheba. David sinned against the Lord.

l.q: When David realized that he sinned against God, what did he do?
l.a: David implored God to cleanse him from his sins. He implored God to cast him not away from His presence nor take the Holy Spirit from him. He is asking God to give him back his joy of salvation and to give him an obedient spirit.

l.q: When we sin against others and against God, what can we do to restore our relationship with God?
l.a: We may try to hide our sins from other people, we may even resort to shifting the blame, but we can never run away from the LORD. God is everywhere and He sees even the motives of our hearts. Instead of running away from God, we need to go to God in prayer and confess our sins. Our gifts and sacrifices will only be displeasing to the LORD if our hearts is not even right with him.
